content.en: Fruit quality prediction: Scientists have been exploring the use of algorithms to determine the internal quality of fruits and detect their soluble solid content. They have used techniques such as visible and near-infrared spectroscopy, hyperspectral imaging, and NIR transmittance spectroscopy, combined with algorithms like partial least squares (PLS), support vector machines (SVM), and genetic algorithms (GA). These methods show promise in accurately predicting the quality attributes of fruits without the need for destructive testing.
content.da: Kvalitetsforudsigelse af frugt: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af algoritmer til at bestemme den interne kvalitet af frugter og opdage deres indhold af opløselige stoffer. De har anvendt teknikker som synligt og nær-infrarødt spektroskopi, hyperspektral billeddannelse og NIR-transmissionsspektroskopi, kombineret med algoritmer som partial least squares (PLS), support vector machines (SVM) og genetiske algoritmer (GA). Disse metoder viser potentiale for nøjagtigt at forudsige kvalitetsegenskaberne af frugter uden behov for destruktiv testning.
